      • createCustomer

        public boolean createCustomer(java.lang.String lastname,
                              java.lang.String firstname,
                              java.lang.String phone,
                              java.lang.String notes)
        Creates a customer and adds it to the Registry.

        If a customer with the same name and phone already exists, do not add and return false.

        Parameters:
        lastname -
        firstname -
        phone -
        notes -
        Returns:
        true if fields are not conflicting with other customer and customer is added.
        See Also:
        isCustomerCorrectFormat(String, String, String, String)

      • updateCustomer

        public boolean updateCustomer(java.lang.String id,
                              java.lang.String last,
                              java.lang.String first,
                              java.lang.String phone,
                              java.lang.String notes)
        Updates customer with the new info.

        If the new values conflicts with existing customer, do not update and return false.

        Parameters:
        id -
        last -
        first -
        notes -
        Returns:
        true if fields are correct and not conflicting with other customers.
        See Also:
        isCustomerCorrectFormat(String, String, String, String)

      • deleteCustomerByID

        public boolean deleteCustomerByID(java.lang.String id)
        Removes customer from the registry.

        All sales from this customer are also removed.

        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        true if Customer is deleted from the Registry, false if no customer is found with this ID

      • getCustomersByTerm

        public java.util.List<Customer> getCustomersByTerm(java.lang.String term)
        Returns customers that match term.

        The term may be either a name, phone or a term in notes.

        Parameters:
        term -
        Returns:
        a list of customers that match term or an empty list if none are found.

      • getCustomerById

        public Customer getCustomerById(java.lang.String id)
        Returns customer that has the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        customer with specified ID or null if no customer is found

      • isCustomerCorrectFormat

        public static boolean isCustomerCorrectFormat(java.lang.String lastname,
                                              java.lang.String firstname,
                                              java.lang.String phone,
                                              java.lang.String notes)
        Checks if Customer fields are in correct format.

        For the fields to be correct they have to:
        1)not be null,
        2)be correct length(names not empty, phone empty or correct length, notes below max length),
        3)not have leading or trailing whitespace.

        Parameters:
        lastname -
        firstname -
        phone -
        notes -
        Returns:
        true if the fields in correct format
        See Also:
        MAX_NAME_LENGTH, PHONE_LENGTH, MAX_NOTES_LENGTH
